chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)
Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer]. The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer] was dismissed by the court.

  • Allen R. Samuel was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) [Modifiers: Alcohol Fine Enhancer], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Allen R. Samuel was found guilty of Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Allen R. Samuel in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Atty Hendee states that there is a pending matter in Adams County (15CF220) and Restitution from that case will be read in to this case.
  Atty Hendee states plea agreement to Counts 1 & 3.  Counts 2 & 4 to be dismissed.  Atty Hendee will be reading in the Adams County case. Atty Hendee waives the right for a PSI to be ordered.  Atty Gumz agrees and makes a statement to the court regarding the Adams County case.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant agrees.
Defendant enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made freely, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  

BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of Counts 1 & 3.  Counts 2 & 4 to be dismissed.

Atty Hendee moves to dismiss the traffic tickets, 15TR1975, 15TR1976, 15TR1977, and 15TR1978.
BY THE COURT:  Traffic tickets to be dismissed.  Court finds 15TR1978 to be reasonable.
Atty Gumz waives the right for a PSI to be ordered.

Atty Hendee makes sentencing recommendations.  
Atty Gumz makes sentencing arguments and asks the court to follow the joint recommendation.  Atty Gumz files an IID exemption with the court.  
Defendant makes a statement to the court.

BY THE COURT:  Count 1:  Withhold Sentence; 36 months Probation with conditions:
*12 months in the Marquette County Jail w/huber
  Report forthwith
*May serve in Adams County or Monroe County
*Electronic Monitoring
*Good Time 
*Pay fine and costs = $1,544
*DNA Sample + $250.00 Surcharge
*36 month DL Revocation 
*36 months Ignition Interlock (after the revocation)
*AODA and any follow-up treatment
*Absolute Sobriety; zero tolerance
*Comply with any and all counseling recommended by the Agent
*Credit = 2 days (if revoked)
  **Court advises defendant that they have been convicted of a Felony and advises rights of voting privileges and of owning a firearm.
Defendant is remanded into custody.

Count 3:  Pay fine and costs = $379.00
DNA Sample + $200.00 Surcharge

Read-in charge from Adams County (15CF220):  Restitution = $6,435.95 (as per the supplement) 
Court approves that Restitution amount and to be paid while on Probation.
Cash bond to be applied to Restitution as to the victim first and then the balance to the insurance company.

Counts 2 & 4 to be dismissed.
15TR1975, 1976, 1977, & 1978 to be dismissed.
No PSI will be ordered.

Court approves and signs the IID Exemption form that was submitted.
Proposed verdicts=Count 1-Count 4
Revised/Additional Witness

TRANSCRIPT OF MOTION TO SUPPRESS ON 2/12/16 - KAREN BLAIR, REPORTER

Defendant Allen R. Samuel in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
15TR1975 - 1978 TRACKING:
Atty Hendee states that this is the defendant's motion to suppress.  Atty Gumz agrees.
Joe Stolpa called and sworn; examined by Atty Hendee.
Cross-examined by Atty Gumz.
Re-direct by Atty Hendee.
Clarification by Atty Gumz.
Witness excused.

Brian Noll called and sworn; examined by Atty Hendee.
Cross-examined by Atty Gumz.
Re-direct by Atty Hendee.
Exhibit 1 (squad video) marked & offered by Atty Hendee.    Atty Gumz has no issue with Exhibit 1 being received.
BY THE COURT:  Exhibit 1 received.
Witness excused.

BY THE COURT:  Court gives 30 days for the transcript to be submitted to counsel.  
Court gives 20 days to counsel to submit their briefs to the court.
Court gives 15 days for counsel to respond.
Court will then have a written decision to counsel 10 days after that.
Motion hearing at 02-12-2016 09:30 am

State files Information (2 counts expanded to include the alcohol enhancer).  Defendant received the Information and waives it's reading.  Defendant enters Not Guilty plea to all charges.

Defendant Allen R. Samuel in court with attorney Mark Jay Gumz.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waives his right to preliminary hearing.  Atty Gumz makes statement.  Court questions defendant as to his waiver and finds it to be made freely, voluntarily and intelligently.  BY THE COURT:  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it.  Case bound over for trial or further proceedings. Defendant Allen R. Samuel in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that the defendant stopped by his office this morning asking about counsel.  Court questions the defendant.  Defendant states that he does not qualify for PD.  Court states that he should verify with Atty Gumz that he does not qualify.    Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands his options.  Defendant asks that this be reset to give time for the defendant to get counsel.  Defendant waives the time limits for the Prelim.

BY THE COURT:  Time limits waived for the Prelim.
Reset.
bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 2, 2015 at 10:00 am.
